ClassInfo.author: JEAF Development Team
ClassInfo.description: Class contains message constants for JEAF Generator.

Message.defaultText: XSLT style sheet ''{0}'' can not be found within the applications class path.
Message.description: Exceptions with this error code are thrown if the style sheet that defines the transformation of the XML document containing error messages is not located within the applications class path.
Message.name: STYLESHEET_NOT_AVAILABLE

Message.defaultText: Unable to create directory ''{0}''.
Message.description: Exceptions with this error code are thrown if the generator can not create an output directory for a generated class.
Message.name: UNABLE_TO_CREATE_DIR

Message.defaultText: Unable to generate Java class ''{0}'' out of message resource ''{1}''.
Message.description: Exceptions with this error code are thrown if an exception occurs during the generation of the Java class using XSLT.
Message.name: UNABLE_TO_PERFORM_TRANSFORMATION

Message.defaultText: Unable to convert Excel workbook to message resource file. Class-Information is incomplete or invalid. Affected field ''{0}'' in file ''{1}''.
Message.description: Exceptions with this error code are thrown if an exception occurs during the generation of the Java class using XSLT.
Message.name: INVALID_CLASS_INFO

Message.defaultText: Unable to open Excel workbook ''{0}''. {1}
Message.description: Exceptions with this error code are thrown when an exception occurs when trying to open an Excel workbook.
Message.name: UNABLE_TO_OPEN_EXCEL_WORKBOOK

Message.defaultText: Unable to close Excel workbook ''{0}''. {1}
Message.description: Exceptions with this error code are thrown when an exception occurs when trying to close an Excel workbook.
Message.name: UNABLE_TO_CLOSE_EXCEL_WORKBOOK

Message.defaultText: Required sheet ''{0}'' inside Excel workbook ''{1}'' is missing. Please ensure that you use the right Excel template for message resources.
Message.description: Exceptions with this error code are thrown if class info is missing in the provided Excel workbook.
Message.name: CLASS_INFO_SHEET_MISSING

Message.defaultText: Unable to create new XML document.
Message.description: Exceptions with this error code are thrown if a new XML document could not be created.
Message.name: UNABLE_TO_CREATE_XML_DOCUMENT

Message.defaultText: Excel workbook ''{0}'' does not contain any message data. Please ensure that the excel file contains at least one sheet with message data.
Message.description: Exceptions with this error code are thrown if a new XML document could not be created.
Message.name: NO_MESSAGE_DATA_IN_WORKBOOK

Message.defaultText: Excel sheet ''{0}'' does not contain required column with name ''{1}''. Please ensure that you use the right Excel template for message resources.
Message.description: Exceptions with this error code are thrown if a required column in message data is missing.
Message.name: INVALID_MESSAGE_DATA

Message.defaultText: Ignoring row ''{1}'' in Excel sheet ''{0}'' as it does not contain values for all required columns. The following fields are missing: {2}
Message.description: Exceptions with this error code are thrown if values for one or more required fields are missing.
Message.name: IGNORING_ROW

Message.defaultText: Message-ID ''{0}'' is not unique. Excel sheet ''{1}'' contains this message ID even though it was already used before. Please ensure that every message ID is globally only used once.
Message.description: Exceptions with this error code are thrown if a message ID is used multiple times.
Message.name: MESSAGE_ID_NOT_UNIQUE

Message.defaultText: Message-Name ''{0}'' is not unique. Excel sheet ''{1}'' contains this name even though it was already used before. Please ensure that every message name is only used once per Excel file.
Message.description: Exceptions with this error code are thrown if a message name is used multiple times.
Message.name: MESSAGE_NAME_NOT_UNIQUE

Message.defaultText: Ignoring empty sheet ''{0}'' within Excel workbook.
Message.description: Exceptions with this error code are thrown if a message name is used multiple times.
Message.name: IGNORING_EMPTY_SHEET

Message.defaultText: JEAF Generator expects JEAF Meta Model (JMM) revision ''{0}'' or higher. Please update your UML project to a newer version of JMM. Your current revision is: {1}
Message.description: JEAF Generator expects a specific version of the so called JEAF Meta Model (JMM). The JMM version that is used by your UML Model seems to be outdated. Please upgrade to latest version of JMM.
Message.name: INVALID_JMM

Message.defaultText: «RESTOperation» ''{0}(...)'' has parameter type(s) ''{1}'' that are not compatible with OpenAPI (''{2}''). For further details please refer to FAQ entry #2.2 on https://anaptecs.atlassian.net/l/cp/ndmtZxvX"
Message.description: When working with OpenAPI and REST there are some restrictions concerning the data types that can be used in Java. This warning tells you that in a specific REST operation a incompatible parameter or return type is used. This will lead to an invalid request / response from an OpenAPI perspective.
Message.name: INCOMPATIBLE_OPENAPI_TYPE

Message.defaultText: '{0}'' seems to use file system references. This might lead to portabilty issues with the exported XMI files. For further details please refer to FAQ entry #2.1 on https://anaptecs.atlassian.net/l/cp/ndmtZxvX"
Message.description: Depending on how you export XMI files from your MagicDraw model it might happen that the files contain information about file systems paths. This should not be an issue on the machine where you exported the files. However, it may lead to problems on other devices or your CI/CD infrastructure where file system paths might not be the same.
Message.name: LOCAL_FILE_PATH_IN_XMI

Message.defaultText: «BeanParam» ''{0}'' has propertie(s) ''{1}'' that are not comaptible with OpenAPI (''{2}''). For further details please refer to FAQ entry #2.2 on https://anaptecs.atlassian.net/l/cp/ndmtZxvX
Message.description: When working with OpenAPI and REST there are some restrictions concerning the data types that can be used in Java. This warning tells you that in a defined "BeanParam" at least one property uses an incompatible type. This will lead to an invalid request / response from an OpenAPI perspective.
Message.name: INCOMAPTIBLE_TYPE_IN_BEAN_PARAM

Message.defaultText: Resource path of «RESTResource» ''{0}'' must either start with ''/'' or might be not set at all.
Message.description: When defining the path of a REST resource then the path that is defined on the RESTResource (not RESTOperation) must start with a '/'
Message.name: INVALID_REST_RESOURCE_PATH

Message.defaultText: Either «RESTResource» or «RESTOperation» must define a resource path for operation ''{0}(...)''
Message.description: The resource path of an "RESTOperation" is the combination of the path of the "RESTResource" and the "RESTOperation". However at least one of them has to be defined.
Message.name: NO_REST_RESOURCE_PATH

Message.defaultText: «RESTOperation» ''{0}(...)'' has an invalid path. Path of operation must not start with ''/''.
Message.description: The path of a "RESTOperation" must not start with '/'.
Message.name: INVALID_REST_OPERSTION_PATH

Message.defaultText: «RESTOperation» ''{0}(...)'' must define at least one HTTP-Method. Please correct your UML model.
Message.description: Each "RESTOperation" must define at least one HTTP method. If this message occurs then you have to fix your UML Model.
Message.name: NO_HTTP_METHOD_DEFINED

Message.defaultText: «RESTOperation» uses http status code ''{0}'' which is not compatible with JAX-RS.
Message.description: The "RESTOperation" uses a HTTP status code that is not compatible with JAX-RS standard.
Message.name: INVALID_HTTP_STATUS_CODE

Message.defaultText: For «RESTOperation» ''{0}(...)'' no consumed media type is defined. The information can be defined either on the «RESTResource» or «RESTOperation».
Message.description: The supported consumed media types can either be defined on the "RESTResource" or on the "RESTOperation" but at least on one of them the information has to be defined.
Message.name: NO_CONSUMED_MEDIA_TYPE_DEFINED

Message.defaultText: For «RESTOperation» ''{0}(...)'' no produced media type is defined. The information can be defined either on the «RESTResource» or «RESTOperation».
Message.description: The produced media types can either be defined on the "RESTResource" or on the "RESTOperation" but at least on one of them the information has to be defined.
Message.name: NO_PRODUCED_MEDIA_TYPE_DEFINED

Message.defaultText: «RESTOperation» ''{0}(...)'' has input parameters without name. Please ensure that all input parameters are named.
Message.description: All input paramaters of a "RESTOperation" have to have a name. Please fix the issue in your UML model.
Message.name: REST_INPUT_PARAM_WITHOUT_NAME

Message.defaultText: «RESTOperation» ''{0}(...)'' has multiple request body parameters. Please ensure that there is not more than 1 request body for a REST operation. The following paramaters are treated as body parameters: {1}
Message.description: All input paramaters that are not explicitly marked as "HeaderParam", "PathParam", "BeanParam" etc. are treated as body. However REST only supports one body per request. So please ensure that there is not more than 1 body per request.
Message.name: MULTIPLE_REQUEST_BODIES

Message.defaultText: «RESTOperation» ''{0}(...)'' has request body parameter even though its http method(s) ''{1}'' do(es) not allow it.
Message.description: A "RESTOperation" defines a body paramater, however it's HTTP method does not allow to use a body.
Message.name: REQUEST_BODY_NOT_ALLOWED

Message.defaultText: UML Model contains has more than one global default error response.
Message.description: It's not allowed to have more than 1 global error reponse for an OpenAPI specification in an UML Model.
Message.name: MORE_THAN_ONE_GLOBAL_ERROR_RESPONSE

Message.defaultText: «OpenAPIResponse» ''{0}'' needs to define exactly one reference to «OpenAPIType» that is used as response type.
Message.description: "OpenAPIResponse" types need to define exactly one response type
Message.name: TO_MANY_OPEN_API_RESPONSE_TYPES

Message.defaultText: «OpenAPIDataType» ''{0}'' must have excatly one property as long as they are not marked as composite data types.
Message.description: "OpenAPIDataType" must have 1 property as long as they are not modeled as composite data types.
Message.name: OPEN_API_DATA_TYPE_TOO_MANY_PROPERTIES

Message.defaultText: «OpenAPIDataType» ''{0}'' has property that is not a primitive.
Message.description: "OpenAPIDataType" must only have primitive types of properties, as long as they are not modeled as composite data types.
Message.name: OPEN_API_DATA_TYPE_ONLY_PRIMITIVES

Message.defaultText: «OpenAPIDataType» ''{0}'' must not have multivalued properties.
Message.description: "OpenAPIDataType" must not have multivalued properties, as long as they are not modeled as composite data types.
Message.name: OPEN_API_DATA_TYPE_NO_MULTIVALUED_PROPERTIES

Message.defaultText: «OpenAPIDataType» ''{0}'' must not have a prante class.
Message.description: "OpenAPIDataType" must not have parent classes.
Message.name: OPEN_API_DATA_TYPE_PARENT_NOT_SUPPORTED

Message.defaultText: «PathParam» ''{0}'' needs to be defined as required in the UML Model.
Message.description: When defining a path param for a "RESTOperation" it is required that path paramaters are required.
Message.name: PATH_PARAM_MUST_BE_REQUIRED

Message.defaultText: «PathParam» ''{0}'' must not be defined as multivalued in the UML Model.
Message.description: "PathParam" must not be defined as multivalued in the UML Model.
Message.name: PATH_PARAM_MUST_NOT_BE_MULTIVALUED

Message.defaultText: «{0}» ''{1}'' should have a documentation in the UML model.
Message.description: It is strongly recommended that the elements of the UML model have a meaningful documentation ;-)
Message.name: DOCUMENTATION_MISSING

Message.defaultText: «{0}» ''{1}'' must not have a parent class as it is marked to be a composite data type.
Message.description: When working with so called composite data types then inherhitance is not suppported for them.
Message.name: NO_PARENT_FOR_COMPOSITE_DATA_TYPES
